required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Seroquel SR in the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Centre, Double-Blind, Randomised, Parallel-Group, Placebo-Controlled Phase III Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Quetiapine Fumarate Sustained Release (Seroquel SR) in the Treatment of Elderly Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary purpose of this study is to evaluate whether treatment with (SEROQUEL SR) quetiapine fumarate sustained release (SR) for 9 weeks compared to placebo will improve depressive symptoms in elderly patients with major depressive disorder.
PLEASE NOTE: Seroquel SR and Seroquel XR refer to the same formulation. The SR designation was changed to XR after consultation with FDA.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score to Week 9.
primary_outcome.description: MADRS total score (0-60 units), where lower scores indicate less depressive symptoms, calculated as Week 9 value - baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Health-related Quality of Life, Enjoyment and Satisfaction (Q-LES-Q)
secondary_outcome.description: Q-LES-Q as percent of maximum (0 to 100%) calculated as Week 9 - baseline, where higher values indicate better quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for Satisfaction With Medication From Quality of Life, Enjoyment, Satisfaction Questionaire (Q-LES-Q)
secondary_outcome.description: Item 15 the Quality of Life, Enjoyment Satisfaction Questionnaire (score 1 least -5 best) on Q-LES-Q, calculated as Week 9 value - baseline value

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Anxiety Symptoms Measured by Hamilton Anxiety 14 Item Scale (HAM-A)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in HAM-A total score (total score 0-56), calculated as Week 9 value - baseline value, where lower scores indicate less anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Sleep Quality as Measured by the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index
secondary_outcome.description: The Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index is an eighteen questionnaire scored with 7 sleep component scores each on a 0 to 3 scale, total score range from 0 to 21, worst value 21, best value 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Suicidal Thoughts as Measured by Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Item 10
secondary_outcome.description: The suicide item is a single item of the Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale with a range of values from 0 to 6, worst value 6, best value 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Somatic Symptoms Cluster From the Hamilton Anxiety Scale (HAM-A)
secondary_outcome.description: The Somatic symptom Cluster of the Hamilton Anxiety Scale is a 7 item cluster associated with somatic symptoms *somatic muscular, somatic sensory, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, gastrointestinal system, genitourinary system, autonomic system) with a range of values from 0 to 28, worst value 28, best value 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Tolerability as Measured by Adverse Event Withdrawals During Treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients, 66 years or older, with a documented clinical diagnosis of MDD.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The presence of dementia or mental disorder other than MDD within 6 months of enrolment,
- Uncontrolled hypertension, substance or alcohol abuse
- A current diagnosis of cancer or a current or past diagnosis of stroke

link.description: AstraZeneca Clinical Trial Information - Outside US

responsible_party.name_title: Martin Brecher, Seroquel Medical Science Director

participant_flow.recruitment_details: International multi-center study, 53 sites recruited between Sept 2006 and Dec 2007
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screening for eligibility and wash-out of restricted medications. At least moderate depression symptoms assessed by the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression

group.title: Quetiapine XR
group.description: Quetiapine fumarate XR - flexibly dosed (50 - 300 mg)

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not complete 61 days of treatment

group.title: Quetiapine XR
group.description: Quetiapine fumarate XR - flexibly dosed (50 - 300 mg)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score to Week 9.
outcome.description: MADRS total score (0-60 units), where lower scores indicate less depressive symptoms, calculated as Week 9 value - baseline value.
outcome.population: All randomized patients who took at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post baseline assessment, with last observation carried forward to week 9 for patients who did not complete the study.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline for Satisfaction With Medication From Quality of Life, Enjoyment, Satisfaction Questionaire (Q-LES-Q)
outcome.description: Item 15 the Quality of Life, Enjoyment Satisfaction Questionnaire (score 1 least -5 best) on Q-LES-Q, calculated as Week 9 value - baseline value
outcome.population: All randomized patients who took at least one dose of study medication and had at least one post baseline assessment, with last observation carried forward to week 9 for patients who did not complete the study. Patients not on medication at baseline would have left the item blank and therefore no change from baseline could be calculated

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI agrees to collaborate in good faith with AstraZeneca with regard to the contents and formation of any publication or disclosure to be made by the PI and to pay due consideration to the comments, views and opinions offered by AstraZeneca.
